other_tests.findings: Necrotizing vasculitis with hemorrhage and surrounding edema, suggestive of ecthyma gangrenosum. Blood cultures and skin biopsy showed Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Skin lesions improved with antipseudomonal antibiotic therapy.

other_tests.findings: HIV type 1 viral load was higher than 7.0 log10 copies/mL.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Six weeks after beginning highly active antiretroviral therapy, the viral load was reduced to 2403 copies/mL (3.38 log10 copies/mL).
After treatment, the CD4+ cell count was 1191/μL.
Neutrophil count increased to 2810/μL after treatment.
